info.title: Azure Alerts Management Service Resource Provider
info.description: Azure Alerts Management Service provides a single pane of glass of alerts across Azure Monitor.

get.description: List all existing alerts, where the results can be filtered on the basis of multiple parameters (e.g. time range). The results can then be sorted on the basis specific fields, with the default being lastModifiedDateTime.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get information related to a specific alert.

200.description: OK. Returns the alert with the specified ID.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get the history of an alert, which captures any monitor condition changes (Fired/Resolved), alert state changes (New/Acknowledged/Closed) and applied action rules for that particular alert.

200.description: OK. Returns the history of the specified alert.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Change the state of an alert.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: List all operations available through Azure Alerts Management Resource Provider.
List alerts meta data information based on value of identifier parameter.

200.description: OK. Successfully listed alert meta data.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: List all existing alerts, where the results can be filtered on the basis of multiple parameters (e.g. time range). The results can then be sorted on the basis specific fields, with the default being lastModifiedDateTime.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get information related to a specific alert. If scope is a deleted resource then please use scope as parent resource of the delete resource. For example if my alert id is '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroup}/providers/Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/vm1/providers/Microsoft.AlertsManagement/alerts/{alertId}' and 'vm1' is deleted then if you want to get alert by id then use parent resource of scope. So in this example get alert by id call will look like this: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroup}/providers/Microsoft.AlertsManagement/alerts/{alertId}'.

200.description: OK. Returns the alert with the specified ID.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Change the state of an alert. If scope is a deleted resource then please use scope as parent resource of the delete resource. For example if my alert id is '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroup}/providers/Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/vm1/providers/Microsoft.AlertsManagement/alerts/{alertId}' and 'vm1' is deleted then if you want to change state of this particular alert then use parent resource of scope. So in this example change state call will look like this: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroup}/providers/Microsoft.AlertsManagement/alerts/{alertId}'.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get the history of an alert, which captures any monitor condition changes (Fired/Resolved), alert state changes (New/Acknowledged/Closed) and applied action rules for that particular alert. If scope is a deleted resource then please use scope as parent resource of the delete resource. For example if my alert id is '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroup}/providers/Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/vm1/providers/Microsoft.AlertsManagement/alerts/{alertId}' and 'vm1' is deleted then if you want to get history of this particular alert then use parent resource of scope. So in this example get history call will look like this: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroup}/providers/Microsoft.AlertsManagement/alerts/{alertId}/history'.

200.description: OK. Returns the history of the specified alert.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get a summarized count of your alerts grouped by various parameters (e.g. grouping by 'Severity' returns the count of alerts for each severity).

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get the enrichments of an alert. It returns a collection of one object named default.

200.description: OK. Returns the enrichments of the specified alert.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

scope.name: scope
scope.description: scope here is resourceId for which alert is created.

alertId.name: alertId
alertId.description: Unique ID of an alert instance.

targetResourceGroup.description: Filter by target resource group name. Default value is select all.
targetResourceGroup.name: targetResourceGroup

targetResource.description: Filter by target resource( which is full ARM ID) Default value is select all.
targetResource.name: targetResource

targetResourceType.description: Filter by target resource type. Default value is select all.
targetResourceType.name: targetResourceType

monitorService.description: Filter by monitor service which generates the alert instance. Default value is select all.
monitorService.name: monitorService

severity.description: Filter by severity.  Default value is select all.
severity.name: severity

smartGroupIdFilter.description: Filter the alerts list by the Smart Group Id. Default value is none.
smartGroupIdFilter.name: smartGroupId

alertState.description: Filter by state of the alert instance. Default value is to select all.
alertState.name: alertState

monitorCondition.description: Filter by monitor condition which is either 'Fired' or 'Resolved'. Default value is to select all.
monitorCondition.name: monitorCondition

alertRule.description: Filter by specific alert rule.  Default value is to select all.
alertRule.name: alertRule

timeRange.description: Filter by time range by below listed values. Default value is 1 day.
timeRange.name: timeRange

customTimeRange.description: Filter by custom time range in the format <start-time>/<end-time>  where time is in (ISO-8601 format)'. Permissible values is within 30 days from  query time. Either timeRange or customTimeRange could be used but not both. Default is none.
customTimeRange.name: customTimeRange

includeContext.description: Include context which has contextual data specific to the monitor service. Default value is false'
includeContext.name: includeContext

includeEgressConfig.description: Include egress config which would be used for displaying the content in portal.  Default value is 'false'.
includeEgressConfig.name: includeEgressConfig

includeSmartGroupsCount.description: Include count of the SmartGroups as part of the summary. Default value is 'false'.
includeSmartGroupsCount.name: includeSmartGroupsCount

pageCount.description: Determines number of alerts returned per page in response. Permissible value is between 1 to 250. When the "includeContent"  filter is selected, maximum value allowed is 25. Default value is 25.
pageCount.name: pageCount

alertsSortBy.description: Sort the query results by input field,  Default value is 'lastModifiedDateTime'.
alertsSortBy.name: sortBy

alertsSummaryGroupBy.description: This parameter allows the result set to be grouped by input fields. For example, groupby=severity,alertstate.
alertsSummaryGroupBy.name: groupby

sortOrder.description: Sort the query results order in either ascending or descending.  Default value is 'desc' for time fields and 'asc' for others.
sortOrder.name: sortOrder

select.description: This filter allows to selection of the fields(comma separated) which would  be part of the essential section. This would allow to project only the  required fields rather than getting entire content.  Default is to fetch all the fields in the essentials section.
select.name: select

identifier.name: identifier
identifier.description: Identification of the information to be retrieved by API call.

operationsList.description: Lists the operations available in the AlertsManagement RP.

nextLink.description: URL to fetch the next set of alerts.

AlertsManagementErrorResponse.description: An error response from the service.

code.description: Error code, intended to be consumed programmatically.

message.description: Description of the error, intended for display in user interface.

target.description: Target of the particular error, for example name of the property.

details.description: A list of additional details about the error.

alert.description: An alert created in alert management service.

nextLink.description: URL to fetch the next set of alerts.

egressConfig.description: Config which would be used for displaying the data in portal.

alertContext.description: Information specific to the monitor service that gives more contextual details about the alert.

isSuppressed.description: Value indicating whether alert is suppressed.

essentials.description: This object contains consistent fields across different monitor services.

severity.description: Severity of alert Sev0 being highest and Sev4 being lowest.

signalType.description: The type of signal the alert is based on, which could be metrics, logs or activity logs.

alertState.description: Alert object state, which can be modified by the user.

monitorCondition.description: Can be 'Fired' or 'Resolved', which represents whether the underlying conditions have crossed the defined alert rule thresholds.

targetResource.description: Target ARM resource, on which alert got created.

targetResourceName.description: Name of the target ARM resource name, on which alert got created.

targetResourceGroup.description: Resource group of target ARM resource, on which alert got created.

targetResourceType.description: Resource type of target ARM resource, on which alert got created.

monitorService.description: Monitor service on which the rule(monitor) is set.

alertRule.description: Rule(monitor) which fired alert instance. Depending on the monitor service,  this would be ARM id or name of the rule.

sourceCreatedId.description: Unique Id created by monitor service for each alert instance. This could be used to track the issue at the monitor service, in case of Nagios, Zabbix, SCOM etc.

smartGroupId.description: Unique Id of the smart group

smartGroupingReason.description: Verbose reason describing the reason why this alert instance is added to a smart group

startDateTime.description: Creation time(ISO-8601 format) of alert instance.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: Last modification time(ISO-8601 format) of alert instance.

monitorConditionResolvedDateTime.description: Resolved time(ISO-8601 format) of alert instance. This will be updated when monitor service resolves the alert instance because the rule condition is no longer met.

lastModifiedUserName.description: User who last modified the alert, in case of monitor service updates user would be 'system', otherwise name of the user.

actionGroup.description: The action group that was triggered

notificationResult.description: The result of the notification delivery

statusURL.description: URL endpoint for checking notification delivery status. Only populated when status is 'Inline'.

alertsSummary.description: Summary of alerts based on the input filters and 'groupby' parameters.

total.description: Total count of the result set.

smartGroupsCount.description: Total count of the smart groups.

metadataIdentifier.description: Identification of the information to be retrieved by API call

status.description: The status of the evaluation of the enrichment.

errorMessage.description: The error message. Will be present only if the status is 'Failed'.

linkToApi.description: Link to Prometheus query API (Url format).

datasources.description: An array of the azure monitor workspace resource ids.

items.description: The azure monitor workspace resource id.

grafanaExplorePath.description: Partial link to the Grafana explore API.

time.description: The date and the time of the evaluation.

start.description: The start evaluation date and time in ISO8601 format.

end.description: The end evaluation date and time in ISO8601 format.

step.description: Query resolution step width in ISO8601 format.

alertEnrichmentProperties.description: Properties of the alert enrichment item.

alertId.description: Unique Id (GUID) of the alert for which the enrichments are being retrieved.

nextLink.description: Request URL that can be used to query next page.

customProperties.description: Custom properties that can hold any user defined key-value pairs
